newsitem.title: USA: Chrysler prices 1997 Dodge Viper at $66,700.
newsitem.headline: Chrysler prices 1997 Dodge Viper at $66,700.

text.p: Chrysler Corp said Friday the 1997 Dodge Viper RT/10 Roadster will carry a suggested retail price of $66,700, including a $700 destination charge.
The 1997 Dodge Viper RT/10 goes into production this summer. The original Viper RT/10 was introduced in 1992.

The new roadster features include standard power glass windows replacing the plastic side curtains, dual air bags, electronic door latches and an electronic security system. A compact disc player and air conditioning are standard for 1997, Chrysler said in a news release.
In addition to a soft top, the 1997 Dodge Viper RT/10 Roadster has as standard equipment a removable body-color hard top that has been redesigned to increase headroom slightly.
Both the hard top and air conditioning may be deleted for a lower base price. The hard top is a $2,500 delete option, while air conditioning is $1,000.
